django.db.backends.sqlite3.base

check_constraints(table_names=None)[source]

Check each table name in table_names for rows with invalid foreign key references. This method is intended to be used in conjunction with disable_constraint_checking() and enable_constraint_checking(), to determine if rows with invalid references were entered while constraint checks were off.

is_usable()[source]

django.db.backends.sqlite3.base.FORMAT_QMARK_REGEX[source]
class django.db.backends.sqlite3.base.SQLiteCursorWrapper[source]

Bases: sqlite3.dbapi2.Cursor

Django uses the “format” and “pyformat” styles, but Python’s sqlite3 module supports neither of these styles.

This wrapper performs the following conversions:

  • “format” style to “qmark” style

  • “pyformat” style to “named” style

In both cases, if you want to use a literal “%s”, you’ll need to use “%%s”.
